required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of Gene-activated Bone Substitute and Autobone in Treatment of Long Bone Nonunions
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study of Gene-activated Bone Substitute Based on Octacalcium Phosphate and Plasmid DNA Encoding VEGFA Gene Mixed With Autobone and Bone Autograft From Iliac Crest in Treatment of Long Bone Nonunions With Bone Loss: an Open-label Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: S. M. Kirov Military Medical Academy of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: The study is aimed to compare the effectiveness of "Histograft" bone substitute (gene-activated bone substitute based on octacalcium phosphate and plasmid DNA encoding VEGFA gene) mixed with shredded autobone and pure shredded auto bone harvested from iliac crest in treatment of patients with long bone nonunions

detailed_description.textblock:
An open-label randomized controlled clinical trial, two cohorts. Patients who met the inclusion criteria are planned to be enrolled into the trial. Upon enrollment, all patients will undergo screening, a set of clinical examination, instrumental investigations and laboratory tests, including CT of the affected bone with the assessment of nonunion.
All patients enrolled in the study will be subjected to bone reconstructive surgery with nonunion excision and bone grafting with either investigational bone substitute mixed with shredded autobone (in a ratio of 50/50) harvested during the surgery or pure shredded autobone from iliac crest.
The clinical study results will be evaluated at the time points of 1, 15, 45, 90, 180 days with clinical examination, instrumental investigations and laboratory tests. Control CT will be carried out for the primary outcome measure at 90, 180, 360 days after surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Radiographic assessment of bone healing using REBORNE scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events frequency

secondary_outcome.measure: Ability to use the operated limb
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical assessment using DASH scale (for upper limb) or LEFS scale (for lower limb)
Level of pain measured using Numeric Rating Scale

clinical_study.condition: Non-Union of Ankle Joint Without Infection

arm_group.description: bone reconstructive surgery with the use of "Histograft" bone substitute (gene-activated matrix based on octacalcium phosphate and plasmid DNA encoding VEGFA gene) mixed with shredded autobone (in a ratio of 50/50) harvested during the surgery
bone reconstructive surgery with the use of shredded bone autograft harvested from iliac crest

intervention.intervention_name: "Histograft", a bone substitute based on octacalcium phosphate (OCP) and plasmid DNA encoding VEGFA gene
intervention.description: gene-activated bone substitute in granular form, concentration of the plasmid DNA is 100 Î¼g per 1.0 g of the OCP scaffold

study_pop.textblock: patients aged 18-70 with non-unions of long bones

facility.name: S.M. Kirov Military Medical Academy, Department of Traumatology and Orthopaedics

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD could be shared through official depositories located on the clinical base official web site
